justification: The Erikson Psychosocial Stage Inventory (EPSI) was used to assess identity synthesis, with items such as 'I know what kind of person I am' indicating the feeling that one's self is temporally continuous and consistent.
The Erikson Psychosocial Stage Inventory (EPSI) was used to measure identity confusion, with items like 'I feel mixed up' assessing the feeling of one's self as temporally changeable and fragmented.
Detrended Fluctuation Analysis (DFA) was applied to quantify LRTC, with the DFA exponent (DFAe) reflecting the degree of long-range temporal correlation in the neuronal activity.

Participants who showed stronger LRTC in the frontocentral alpha EEG had higher temporal consistency in their occupational preference judgments, suggesting less random noise-contaminated internal criteria.
